llm_res.rule: The function SHOULD throw unless the _from account has deliberately authorized the sender of the message via some mechanism.

The `decimals` function should return the number of decimals the token uses - e.g. 8, means to divide the token amount by 100000000 to get its user representation. This method can be used to improve usability, but interfaces and other contracts MUST NOT expect these values to be present.
The `allowance` function should return the amount which _spender is still allowed to withdraw from _owner.
The function `name()` should return the name of the token. This is an optional method but if implemented, it should return the actual token name.
